properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 8:40AM EST until February 15 at 12:55PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in
Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

.The Ohio River at Pittsburgh is expected to remain above 18 feet
due to recent rainfall, flooding the Monongahela Parking
Wharf. The threat for additional rainfall and subsequent rise will
prompt the continuation of the advisory through the end of the week,
despite a brief period where the Point may fall below 18 feet.

The Flood Advisory continues for
the Ohio River At Pittsburgh.
* Until Saturday afternoon.
* At 8:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 19.2 feet.
* Action stage is 18.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise to 19.7 feet this evening. It will
then fall to 16.8 feet and begin rising again Thursday morning. It
will rise to 19.1 feet Friday morning. It will then fall again and
remain below flood stage.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
* Impact...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the north shore
riverwalk between the stadiums.
* Impact...At 19.5 feet, The Mon Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower
areas of the North Shore Riverwalk.
properties.instruction:
This Flood Advisory means river flows are elevated.  Heed any road
closures.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz .

NWSheadline: The Flood Advisory is now in effect until early Saturday afternoon
